text: Echeveria laui is a slow-growing perennial succulent plant native to the state of Oaxaca, Mexico.R. Moran & J. Meyran, 1976 In: Cact. Suc. Mex., 21(3): 59World Plants: Synonymic Checklists of the Vascular Plants of the World It is a popular decorative plant due it its distinctive pink color. ==Etymology== Echeveria is named for Atanasio Echeverría y Godoy, a botanical illustrator who contributed to Flora Mexicana.Gledhill, David (2008). "The Names of Plants". Cambridge University Press. (hardback), (paperback). p. 149 ==References== laui Category:Plants described in 1976
title: Echeveria laui
